lang="la">illud nomen simpliciter positum, hoc ad aliquid esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes Simpliciter positae, scaena sine arte fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevius ac simplicius tradi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: ignorare se dixit, quidnam perplexi sua legatio haberet, cum simpliciter ad amicitiam petendam venissent,</quote> <trans><tr>simply</tr>, <tr>purely</tr>, <tr>only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam ludere eum simpliciter, quidam haud dubie insanire, aiebant,</quote> <trans><tr>merely</tr>, <tr>only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenaica philosophia, quam ille et ejus posteri simpliciter defenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiā simpliciter e re publicā ferendā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. ad Quir. 10, 24</bibl></cit> B. and K.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molluscum simplicius sparsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44323.3" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uprightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candidly</hi>: simpliciter et candide, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simpliciter scripserat quae sentiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simpliciter et libere (opp. dissimulanter et furtim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simpliciter et palam lusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me amice simpliciterque reprehenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se simpliciter credunt amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates simplicius nutrire (opp. callide),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo simplicius tibi confitebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicissime loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44323.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In the singular number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
simplicabilis: <entryFree id="n44324" type="main" key="simpli^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>simplico</etym>, <sense id="n44324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">simple</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simplicitas: <entryFree id="n44325" type="main" key="simpli^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplĭcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>simplex</etym>. <sense id="n44325.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">simpleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period, esp. in the signif. II.; not found in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">candor, sinceritas): sunt solida primordia simplicitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:609 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 609 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 574</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indigesta (ligni),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>plainness</tr>, <tr>straightness of grain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44325.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a moral sense, <hi rend="ital">plainness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">openness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">candor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">directness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingenuousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naturalness</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis incauti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:3 al" default="NO">2, 43, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo antiquae simplicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir simplicitatis generosissimae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the noblest honesty</tr>, <tr>candor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 125 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:47:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 47, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SIMU" /> 21, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">callidissima simplicitatis imitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:242 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 242 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:20" default="NO">9, 4, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simpliciter: <entryFree id="n44326" type="main" key="simpli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. simplex <sense id="n44326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
simplico: <entryFree id="n44327" type="hapax" key="simpli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>simplex</etym>, <sense id="n44327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make single</hi> or <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike a single root</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 15, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simplo: <entryFree id="n44328" type="main" key="simplo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplify</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 281</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simpludiarea: <entryFree id="n44329" type="gloss" key="simplu^di^a_re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplŭdĭārĕa</orth> <itype>funera sunt, quibus adhibentur duntaxat ludi</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=335" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 335</bibl> Müll. [contr. from simplus-ludus].</entryFree>
simplus: <entryFree id="n44330" type="main" key="simplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n44330.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> <etym>kindr. with simplex</etym>, <hi rend="ital">simple;</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos> only post-class.: mors, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 878.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n44330.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44330.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">simplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is single</hi> or <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the simple sum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">number</hi> (opp. to the double): <cit><quote lang="la">duplum simplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 11, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplum solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit> (opp. duplum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 14</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">si simplum imperetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44330.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">simpla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. pecunia), <hi rend="ital">the simple purchase-money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simpulariarius: <entryFree id="n44331" type="gloss" key="simpu^la_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simpŭlārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>simpulum</etym>, <sense id="n44331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of</hi> simpula, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4283</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simpulatrix: <entryFree id="n44332" type="gloss" key="simpu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simpŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, v. simpulum.</entryFree>
simpulum: <entryFree id="n44333" type="main" key="simpu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sim-; root sam-; cf.: simul, simplex, and pul-; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">polu/s</foreign>, plenus; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 74</etym>, <sense id="n44333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small ladle</hi>: simpulum vas parvulum non dissimile cyatho, quo vinum in sacrificiis libabatur; <cit><quote lang="la">unde et mulieres rebus divinis deditae simpulatrices dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=337" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 337</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=124" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 124</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 285</bibl>, and v. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 280; <cit><quote lang="la">3, p. 221 (2d edit.).—Prov.: excitare fluctus in simpulo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make much ado about nothing</tr>, <tr>to raise a tempest in a teapot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 16, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simpuvium: <entryFree id="n44334" type="main" key="simpu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simpŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for offering liquids</hi>, esp. wine, in sacrifices, <hi rend="ital">a sacrificial bowl</hi> (cf.: patera, poculum), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 158</bibl> (Jahn, simpuis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:343" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 235</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 280 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
simul: <entryFree id="n44335" type="main" key="si^mu^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭl</orth> (ante-class. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕmŭl</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. p. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. p. 97</bibl> Ritschl; <sense id="n44335.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕ-mŏl</orth>, C. I. L. 1175 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 96</bibl>; cf. also simitu. The final <hi rend="ital">l</hi> of simul was scarcely pronounced in the vulg. lang., and in comic poetry does not make position with an initial consonant following; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 643 sq.; Lorenz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 567</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sama-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma, o(/mos</foreign></etym>; cf. semel, = eodem tempore, unā, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44335.1" n="I" level="1"> Referring, as temporal adverb, to plural nouns of the same sentence, and representing persons or things as acting, happening, etc., simultaneously. </sense><sense id="n44335.2" n="1" level="3"> After a <hi rend="ital">plural subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ambo in saxo semul sedent ejecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa concurrunt simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(duo homines) simul cenare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zmyrnae cum simul essemus compluris dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres simul soles effulserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tria simul agmina populabantur Indos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo simul hujusmodi personae Ciceroni obstiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othonem multa simul exstimulabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl>.—Sometimes the logical subject is understood: <cit><quote lang="la">multos modios salis simul (i. e. amicis) edendos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes both the subject and predicate are understood: <cit><quote lang="la">quare si simul (i. e. nos agere) placebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.3" n="2" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">plur. object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alcumena) uno partu duos peperit semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas res simul nunc agere decretum'st mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si duos consules simul ex Italiā ejectos ... res publica tenere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo cum simul conspicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul omnibus portis erupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:30" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 30</bibl>; 42, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:23" default="NO">10, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO">10, 7, 16</bibl>.—So with singular implying a plural: <cit><quote lang="la">tota (urbs) simul exsurgere aedificiis coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam simul causam ponit ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—After an adverb. implying a plural noun: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur undique simul (i. e. ex omnibus locis simul) speculatores citi sese ostendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.4" n="3" level="3"> Referring<pb n="1703" /> <cb n="SIMU" />  to plural attributes: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium simul rerum ... discrimine proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum simul civitatium legati Romam convenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.5" n="4" level="3"> Referring to an attributive participle understood: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo plurium simul gentium (= simul eodem loco versantium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trium simul bellorum victor (= eodem tempore gestorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duo simul bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot simul malis victi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44335.6" n="II" level="1"> Referring to nouns, etc., connected by the preposition <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: simul cum = unā cum (v. una, s. v. unus), <hi rend="ital">together with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi (illum) cum Calchā semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jube in urbem veniat jam tecum semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ipsus equidem nunc primum istanc tecum conspicio semul?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me misisti ad portum cum luci semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (amicitia) incepta a parvis cum aetate adcrevit simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul consilium cum re amīsti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Critolaum simul cum Diogene venisse commemoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:38:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 38, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius tecum simul pro Appio Claudio dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum corporibus simul animos interire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobiscum simul considerantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum Cyri simul obsignavi cum Clodio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum lege Aeliā magistratum iniit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum lumine pandit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=704" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 704</bibl></cit> (452): <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum moribus immutatur fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum animā simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum occasu solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 91, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul cum dono designavit templi finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (dictator) se (Fabium) simul cum gloriā rei gestae extinxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cresceret simul et neglegentia cum audaciā hosti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 3</bibl>; 23, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 58</bibl>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">una</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe omnes semul didicimus tecum unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 43</bibl>.—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">mecum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui scribis morderi te interdum quod non simul sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Freq. cum eo (eis, etc.) must be supplied after simul, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with</hi> him, them, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vigiliam quando ibat miles, tum tu ibas semul (i. e. cum eo)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum simul P. Rutilius venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos qui simul erant missi, fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae metu ne simul (i. e. cum iis) Romanus irrumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra turbam ordinem conlocuntur semul (i. e. inter se),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 180</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 13, 3</bibl>.—Simul with <case>abl.</case> alone = cum with <case>abl.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma</foreign> with <case>dat.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">simul his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe simul nobis habitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magnetibus simul transmissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quindecimviri septemviris simul,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:418" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1049" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1049</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n44335.7" n="III" level="1"> Referring to a preceding adverb. clause, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, i.e. as that of the action described: <cit><quote lang="la">juris ubi dicitur dies, simul patronis dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ego vinum bibo, at mandata hau consuevi semul bibere una (= bibere quom vinum bibo, una cum vino),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando nihil sit (quod det), semul amare desinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi res prolatae sunt, quom rus homines eunt, semul prolatae res sunt nostris dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 84</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domum numquam introibis, nisi feres pallam simul (i. e. cum introibis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n44335.8" n="IV" level="1"> Referring to two or more co-ordinate terms or facts representing these as simultaneous, <hi rend="ital">and at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">both ... and</hi> (<hi rend="ital">at once</hi>), <hi rend="ital">together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44335.9" n="1" level="3"> Referring to co-ordinate terms of the same sentence. </sense><sense id="n44335.10" n="a" level="4"> Simul preceding all the coordinate terms which are connected by et, ac, atque, que, or by et ... et (freq. in the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">semul flere sorbereque haud facile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Hortensi ingenium simul aspectum et probatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 64, 228</bibl></cit>: Bomilcar, simul cupidus incepta patrandi, et timore socii anxius, <cb n="SIMU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicenti lacrimae simul spiritum et vocem intercluserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae simul auxilio tribunicio et consensu plebis impediri coepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycios sub Rhodiorum simul imperio et tutelā esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priverni qui simul a Fundanis ac Romanis defecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul divinae humanaeque spei pleni pugnam poscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximio simul honoribus atque virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obruit animum simul luctus metusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ipsum Vitellium contemnebant metuebantque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:12" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7, 3</bibl>; 6, 18, 5; 6, 33, 9; 6, 40, 4; 9, 12, 4; 27, 51, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:54:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 54, 2</bibl>.—So with three or more co-ordinate terms, either all connected by et, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO">10, 7, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or asyndetic: nunc simul res, fides, fama, virtus, decus deseruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.11" n="b" level="4"> Simul after all the coordinate terms (mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc operam potestis ambo mihi dare et vobis simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faxo et operam et vinum perdiderit simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si quis sacrilegii et homicidii simul accusetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:58:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 58, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.12" n="c" level="4"> Simul after the first of the co-ordinate terms (so not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">convenit regnum simul atque locos ut haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 1, 6</bibl></cit>, fr. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis simul ac mente turbatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ubi auditum simul visumque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvere simul ac sudore perfusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestri simul navalique clade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota nuncupabantur simul et solvebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>, ext. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ima simul ac summa foveret aequaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:19" default="NO">6, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:1" default="NO">8, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 30</bibl>.—In post-Aug. prose without any temporal idea, = <hi rend="ital">as well as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani facta simul ac dicta memoratu digna ... deligere constitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prol.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.13" n="d" level="4"> Placed before the last term. </sense><sense id="n44335.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Simul et (= simul etiam), <hi rend="ital">and at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtha, postquam oppidum Capsam aliosque locos munitos, simul et magnam pecuniam amiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marium fatigantem de profectione, simul et invisum et offensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 73, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius hortandi causā, simul et nobilitatem exagitandi, contionem advocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 84:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites modesto imperio habiti, simul et locupletes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseus cum adventu consulis, simul et veris principio strepere omnia cerneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.15" n="(b)" level="5"> Simulque (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut (materia) fragilis incumberet, simulque terra umore diluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.16" n="(g)" level="5"> Simul, without any conjunction (so in Cic., but only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Neptuno grates habeo et tempestatibus, semul Mercurio qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Electra Stereopeque, simul sanctissima Maja,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=270" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 270</bibl></cit> (36): <cit><quote lang="la">inter solis iter, simul inter flamina venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 342</bibl></cit> (101): <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguus consilii, num Dyrrhachium pedite atque equite, simul longis navibus mare clauderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44335.17" n="e" level="4"> Inserted in the last term (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">memor Actae non alio rege puertiae, Mutataeque simul togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">interea Maecenas advenit atque Coccejus, Capitoque simul Fontejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.18" n="2" level="3"> Referring to two or more co-ordinate clauses or sentences. </sense><sense id="n44335.19" n="a" level="4"> Et simul or simulque: <cit><quote lang="la">contundam facta Talthybi, contem namque omnes nuntios, semulque cursuram meditabor ad ludos Olympios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eamus, et de istac simul consilium volo capere una tecum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>while going</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ... et simul quia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio Ecquaenam fuerit origo ... et simul ecquae sit finis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed iidem illi ita mecum loquuntur ... et simul admonent quiddam quod cavebimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuis litteris cognovi festinationem tuam, et simul sum admiratus cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emergit Nixi caput, et simul effert sese clara Fides et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 713</bibl></cit> (460): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam Rutilium consedisse accepit, simulque ex Jugurthae proelio clamorem augeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites ex equis desiliunt, simulque et hosti se opponunt, et animos peditum accendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum rigere omnibus corpora ... et simul lassitudine et ... fame etiam deficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=504" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 504</bibl> (259); 545 (299); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 21</bibl>; Quint. <cb n="SIMU" /> 2, 5, 13.—</sense><sense id="n44335.20" n="b" level="4"> Simul with autem or enim, introducing the second sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">salve! simul autem vale!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: augeamus sane suspicionem tuam; <cit><quote lang="la">simul enim augebimus diligentiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.21" n="c" level="4"> Simul preceding co-ordinate sentences, generally connected by et ... et, but also by a single copulative conjunction: <cit><quote lang="la">simul enim et rei publicae consules, et propones ei exempla ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa autem altera ratio quae simul et opinionem falsam tollit, et aegritudinem detrahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul et inopiam frumenti lenire, et ignaris omnibus parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus portus erat qui simul et omnīs onerarias caperet, et tecta legionibus praeberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul et cohors invasit, et ex omnibus oppidi partibus ... concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: simul Metelli imagines dereptae, et missi qui Antonio nuntiarent. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.22" n="3" level="3"> Referring to co-ordinate clauses introduced by subordinating conjunctions: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnesilochum ut requiram atque ut eum mecum ad te adducam semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum faciam ut notam apponam ... et simul significem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo liberius ad te seribo, quia nostrae laudi favisti, simulque quod video non novitati esse invisum meae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; 7, 10, 3.—If used in connecting dependent clauses, simul often stands for a co-ordinating conjunction; v. VI. infra.</sense><sense id="n44335.23" n="V" level="1"> Introducing an independent sentence, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise</hi> (cf.: itaque, igitur, deinde, tum, etc.). </sense><sense id="n44335.24" n="1" level="3"> Simul alone: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Tiresiam consulam quid faciundum censeat: semul hanc rem ut facta est eloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequimini! simul circumspicite ne quis adsit arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum ipse efficiam ut attente audiatis. Simul illud oro: si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc proprium virtutis existimant ... simul hoc se fore tutiores arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valerio Samnitium legiones occurrunt ... simul in Campanos stimulabat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi (Apollo) decimam partem praedae voveo. Te simul, Juno, precor ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.25" n="2" level="3"> More freq. simul et (= etiam): <cit><quote lang="la">quia videbitur Magis verisimile id esse ... simul et conficiam facilius ego quod volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite committere ut in re tam inveteratā quidquam novi sentiatis. Simul et illa omnia ante oculos vestros proponite, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstravi haec Caecilio. Simul et illud ostendi, me ei satisfacturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati jam reverterant ... simul venerant et ab rege Perseo oratores qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ad Sycurium progressus, opperiri ibi hostium adventum statuit. Simul et frumentari passim exercitum jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:85:349" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 85, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:12:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 12, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 618</bibl> (372); 628 (382); 707 (454); 721 (468); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 100, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 3, 2</bibl>; 40, 32; 4, 49, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53</bibl>; 3, 15; 3, 18; 3, 20; 3, 29; 3, 42; 3, 82.</sense><sense id="n44335.26" n="VI" level="1"> Simul itself stands as co-ordinating conjunction, to connect dependent clauses represented as contemporaneous, <hi rend="ital">and at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also</hi> (not ante-class.; rare in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the histt.): ei Verres possessionem negat se daturum, ne posset patronum suum juvare, simul ut esset poena quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes vocat ad diripiendos Eburones, ut potius Gallorum vita quam legionarius miles periclitetur, simul ut ... pro tali facinore stirps et nomen civitatis tollatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: quippe foedum hominem a republicā procul esse volebat; <cit><quote lang="la">simul quia boni complures praesidium in eo putabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus de virtute, quia multi dixere, praetereundum puto, simul ne per insolentiam quis existumet memet studium meum laudando extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil horum ... discere cum cerneret posse, simul et tirocinio et perturbatione juvenis moveretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sermone Graeco puerum incipere malo, quia Latinum vel nobis nolentibus perhibet, simul quia disciplinis quoque Graecis prius instruendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes">56, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 36</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1</bibl>, <pb n="1704" /> <cb n="SIMU" /> 70; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 15.—So, connecting participial expressions or adverbial phrases with dependent clauses: his amicis confisus Catilina, simul quod aes alienum ingens erat, et quod ... opprimendae reipublicae consilium cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi, quod res in invidiā erat, simul et ab Numidis obsecrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob eam iram, simul ut praeda militem aleret, duo milia peditum ... populari agrum jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 66, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites praemisit speculatum, simul ut ignem exstinguerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Otho, quamquam turbidis rebus, etc., simul reputans non posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 83 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere igitur eum (locum) non fidelissimis sociis noluit, simul quod ab illā parte urbis navibus aditus ex alto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n44335.27" n="VII" level="1"> Simul. as co-ordinating conjunction, is frequently placed before each of the co-ordinate terms (simul ... simul = <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma me\n ... a(/ma de/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">partly ... partly; not only ... but at the same time</hi> (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n44335.28" n="1" level="3"> With independent clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">simul castra oppugnabantur, simul pars exercitūs ad populandum agrum Romanum missa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accolas Hannibal simul perlicit ad naves fabricandas, simul et ipsi traici exercitum cupiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his simul custodes trucidari coepti, simul datum signum armatis ut ex insidiis concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 25, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul gratias agit, simul gratulatur quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:631 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 631 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 220</bibl> sqq.; 12, 268; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.29" n="2" level="3"> With dependent clauses: <cit><quote lang="la">venit ad quaerendum, simul quod non deducerent praesidia, simul quod in Bithyniam auxilia missi forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseus cum audisset, simul Meliboeam a consulis exercitu oppugnari, simul classem Iolci stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul ad Phylan ducit, simul ut praesidium firmaret, simul ut militi frumentum divideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul questi ... simul nuntiantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam imponebatur oneris recepi, simul ut pleniore obsequio demererer amantissimos mei, simul ne ... alienis vestigiis insisterem, Quint. prooem. 3.—Rarely connecting a dependent clause with an independent sentence: Athenas ierant, simul ut pro legatione praemio esset honos, simul peritos legum peregrinarum ad condenda nova jura usui fore credebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 758</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.30" n="3" level="3"> Co-ordinating dependent clauses with adverbial phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani frequenter in castra venerunt, simul sui purgandi causā, simul ut de induciis impetrarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus, simul ne ocio miles deterior fieret, simul avertendae suspicionis causā ... in Maedicam ducere pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44335.31" n="4" level="3"> Connecting single nouns or phrases belonging to the same predicate: <cit><quote lang="la">cum simul fragor rupti pontis, simul clamor Romanorum impetum sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se simul legatos, simul milites missos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Romae simul dilectu, simul tributo conferendo laboratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">increpando simul temeritatem, simul ignaviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vero si mul ab hostibus, simul ab iniquitate loco rum Poeni oppugnabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter simul complorationem feminarum, simul nefandam caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul a mari, simul a terrā ingredienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 513</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 73</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n44335.32" n="VIII" level="1"> Simul, in connection with <hi rend="ital">ac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (also written in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlac</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlatque</orth>), rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, and very rarely with <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, is used as subordinating, temporal conjunction, <hi rend="ital">as soon as.</hi> For simulac, etc., simul alone is freq. </sense><sense id="n44335.33" n="1" level="3"> Simul ac: simul ac lacrimas de ore noegeo (i. e. candido) detersit, Liv. And. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Demenaetum simul ac conspexero hodie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non simul ac se ipse commovit, sensit quid intersit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si simul ac procul conspexit armatos, recessisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecil. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebam, simul ac timere desisses, similem te futurum tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:35:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 35, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcibiades, simul ac se remiserat, dissolutus reperiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi plaudo Ipse domi, simul ac nummos contemplor in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 46</bibl>; id. <cb n="SIMU" /> Or. 2, 27, 117; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 21</bibl>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">primum</hi> (= ut primum): <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac primum ei occasio visa est, quaestor consulem deseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 52</bibl>, § 138; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 43</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n44335.34" n="2" level="3"> Simul atque: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Clodius, simul atque introductus est, rem conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque increpuit suspicio tumultus, artes ilico nostrae conticescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque audivit ejus interitum, suo Marte res suas recuperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque enim se infiexit hic rex in dominatum injustiorem, fit continuo tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 26, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque sibi hic adnuisset, numeraturum se dicebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, simul atque in oppidum venerat, inmittebantur illi continuo Cibyratici canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque de Caesaris adventu cognitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44335.35" n="3" level="3"> Simul ut (v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">simul ut experrecti sumus, visa illa contemnimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ut accepi a Seleuco litteras tuas, statim quaesivi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros omnia consequi potuisse, simul ut velle coepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 5, 3</bibl> (6, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">simul ut, qui sint professi, videro, dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam simul ut supero se totum lumine Cancer extulit, extemplo cedit delapsa Corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=596" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 596</bibl></cit> (349).—</sense><sense id="n44335.36" n="4" level="3"> Simul et: <cit><quote lang="la">simul et quid erit certi, scribam ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ad te statim habebo quod scribam, simul et videro Curionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam accepi simul et in Cumanum veni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; 16, 11, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 3</bibl>. In all these passages the Cod. Med. has simul et, which the editors variously changed into simulatque, simulac, simul ut, simul; so, <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal simul et ortum est, se ipsum diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>, where the vulg. has simul ut, and Madv. reads simul [et] ortum.—</sense><sense id="n44335.37" n="5" level="3"> Simul ubi: <cit><quote lang="la">quod simul ubi conspexit, equites emisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18, 7</bibl></cit> dub. Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n44335.38" n="6" level="3"> Simul alone, = simul atque: <cit><quote lang="la">simul herbae inceperint nasci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic simul argentum repperit, curā sese expedivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: simul limen intrabo, illi extrabunt illico, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 21</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 5 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">simul inflavit tibicen, a perito carmen agnoscitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri, simul in arido constiterunt, in hostes impetum fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul increpuere arma, hostis pedem rettulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=594" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 594</bibl> (349); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 62, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 31, 5</bibl>; 4, 32, 6; 5, 25, 11; 8, 32, 2; 21, 55, 9; 44, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 44, 19; 44, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:567" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 567</bibl>.—Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">primum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul primum magistratio abiit, dicta dies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul primum anni tempus navigabile praebuisset mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 44, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulac: <entryFree id="n44336" type="main" key="si^mu^lac"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlac</orth>, v. simul, VIII.</entryFree>
simulacrum: <entryFree id="n44337" type="main" key="si^mu^la_crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlācrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>simulo</etym>, an image formed in the likeness of a thing, <sense id="n44337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semblance</hi> (class.; syn.: imago, effigies, signum). </sense><sense id="n44337.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of images formed by art, reflected in a mirror, or seen in a dream; of apparitions, visions, etc. (the latter mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n44337.2" n="A" level="2"> Of images formed by art, esp. of statues of the gods, <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">portrait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effigy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus effigiem simulacrumque servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 159</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas et imagines, non animorum simulacra sed corporum ... relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helenae se pingere simulacrum velle dixit (Zeuxis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra magnifica humanis consecrata simulacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf.: simulacrum deae non effigie humanā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum simulacra sanctissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the images of the gods,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 185</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 22 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri aras simulacraque divom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:308" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et bene facta deum frangit simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 419</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 694</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 658 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: simulacra oppidorum,<cb n="SIMU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 28, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balbum in triumpho omnium gentium urbiumque nomina ac simulacra duxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 36</bibl></cit>;
