cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: simulacrum celebrati diei pingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium, fluviorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the Trojan horse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 232</bibl> (for which, effigies, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 184</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n44337.3" n="b" level="4"> Adverb.: ad or per simulacrum (like ad similitudinem, formam), <hi rend="ital">in the form of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the pattern of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurata aedes ad simulacrum templi Veneris collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad simulacrum ignium ardens Pharus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad simulacrum caelestium siderum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti per litterarum simulacra ducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:51" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44337.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantom</hi> seen in a mirror, in a dream, etc.; analogous to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwlon</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecunque apparent nobis simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per aquas, quae nunc rerum simulacra videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1060</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid frustra simulacra fugacia (in aquā visa) captas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 432</bibl></cit>. —Of the <hi rend="ital">shades</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ghosts</hi> of the departed: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam simulacra modis pallentia miris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 123</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 477</bibl> infra); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">est via declivis (in Tartarum) ... umbrae recentes Descendunt illac simulacraque functa sepulcris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 435</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra cara parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 772</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bibere in somnis sitiens cum quaerit ... laticum simulacra petit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1099" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1099</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(canes) Expergefacti secuntur inania saepe Cervorum simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:995" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 995</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra inania somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana (noctis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra modis pallentia miris Visa sub obscurum noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 477</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:650 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 650 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vacua mens audita simulacra et inanes sibi metus fingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44337.5" n="2" level="3"> In the philosoph. lang. of Lucret. (like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)/dwlon</foreign> and the Lat. spectrum), <hi rend="ital">the form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">image</hi> of an object of sense or thought presented to the mind; <hi rend="ital">a representation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conception</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:149" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 149</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n44337.6" n="3" level="3"> Of mnemonic <hi rend="ital">signs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">types</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">emblems</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res ipsas rerum effigies notaret atque ut locis pro cerā, simulacris pro litteris uteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44337.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A description</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a portraiture</hi> of character: <cit><quote lang="la">non inseram simulacrum viri copiosi (Catonis), quae dixerit referendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44337.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A likeness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu disputavi, Hominem quojus rei Similem esse arbitrarer simulacrumque habere: Id repperi jam exemplum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44337.9" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with the predominant idea of mere imitation (opp. to that which is original or real), <hi rend="ital">a shadow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum aliquod ac vestigium civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">haec simulacra sunt auspiciorum, auspicia nullo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:33:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 33, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli simulacra cientes,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>mock-fights</tr>, <tr>sham-fights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 324</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnaeque cient simulacra sub armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 585</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 674</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:529" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 529</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:119" default="NO">7, 119</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum navalis pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam pugnae simulacris ad verum discrimen aciemque justam consuescimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ludicrum pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrentis exercitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilitatis particulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simulamen: <entryFree id="n44338" type="main" key="si^mu^la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>simulo</etym>, <sense id="n44338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an imitation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 727</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulamentum: <entryFree id="n44339" type="hapax" key="si^mu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deception;</hi> with astu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulans: <entryFree id="n44340" type="main" key="si^mu^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of simulo.</entryFree>
simulanter: <entryFree id="n44341" type="main" key="si^mu^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlanter</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātē</orth>, <sense id="n44341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. simulo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A. and B.</sense></entryFree>
simulatilis: <entryFree id="n44342" type="hapax" key="si^mu^la_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>simulo</etym>, <sense id="n44342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi>: umbra, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:276" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulatio: <entryFree id="n44343" type="main" key="si^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>simulo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n44343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falsely assumed appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a false show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feigning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shamming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insincerity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hypocrisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulation</hi>, etc. (class. and very freq.; cf. imitatio). </sense><sense id="n44343.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatio insaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitatio simulatioque virtutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: legis agrariae (with nomen),<pb n="1705" /> <cb n="SIMU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl>: rei publicae, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthici belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <case>abl.</case> adverb., <hi rend="ital">under prelext of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under pretence of</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliones equitum specie ac simulatione collibus circumvehi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores emtos esse Fausti simulatione ad caedem ac tumultum,</quote> <trans><tr>as was pretended for Faustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sociis contra hostīs exercitum mittere, an hostium simulatione contra socios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provocare arma Romana simulatione numinum ausus est,</quote> <trans><tr>under pretence of a divine command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 61</bibl></cit>. —Similarly: <cit><quote lang="la">per simulationem, cum simulatione: per simulationem amicitiae me nefarie prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. Quir. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum simulatione timoris agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44343.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex omni vitā simulatio dissimulatioque tollenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatio et inanis ostentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in specie fictae simulationis, pietas inesse non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ut opus sit simulatione et fallaciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 191</bibl></cit>; so (with perfidia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mea'st simulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">optima est simulatio contra simulantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil simulatio proficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa simulationum nescia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulationum falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 45</bibl></cit>; 6, 54; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:72" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n44343.3" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. t. t.: <foreign lang="greek">ei)rwnei/a</foreign> est simulatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 523</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulator: <entryFree id="n44344" type="main" key="si^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>simulo</etym>. <sense id="n44344.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A copier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitator</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">excitat artificem simulatoremque figurae Morphea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani qualis simulator simius oris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 303</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44344.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A feigner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hypocrite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulator</hi>, etc. (the class. signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n44344.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus cujus rei libet simulator ac dissimulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segnitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 722</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44344.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: in omni oratione simulatorem, quem <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rwna</foreign> Graeci nominarunt, Socratem accepimus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolus et simulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 10:39" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus et simulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simulatque: <entryFree id="n44345" type="main" key="si^mu^latque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlatque</orth>, v. simul, VIII.</entryFree>
simulatrix: <entryFree id="n44346" type="hapax" key="si^mu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>simulator</etym>, <sense id="n44346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (female) <hi rend="ital">transformer;</hi> of Circe, who transformed men into beasts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:551" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 551</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simulo: <entryFree id="n44347" type="main" key="si^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlo</orth>; v. assimulo <sense id="n44347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>similis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44347.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">like</hi> another; <hi rend="ital">to imitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. imitor): corpora igni simulata,</quote> <trans><tr>made like</tr>, <tr>like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbos et non imitabile fulmen simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulet Catonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint crura tibi, simulent quae cornua lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:35:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furias Bacchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 596</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equam (sonus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem (natura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume the form of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:275" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 275</bibl></cit>; 6, 26; 11, 310; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:517" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 517</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri illa Minerva simulata Mentori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. Hom. Od. 3, 22): simulata Troja, <hi rend="ital">a counterfeit Troy</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">which is copied after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built like Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 721</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulata magnis Pergama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latices simulatos fontis Averni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressum simulare,</quote> <trans><tr>to represent</tr>, <tr>paint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum in ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:430" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 430</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: Pallas ... simulat ... terram Prodere cum baccis fetum canentis olivae, <hi rend="ital">represents the earth producing</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 80</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, transf., of a work of art: aera Fortis Alexandri vultum simulantia,</quote> <trans><tr>representing</tr>, <tr>imaging</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 241</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44347.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to represent</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">as being</hi> which has no existence, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi> a thing to be what it is not (while dissimulare is to pretend a thing not to be which really is, to conceal), <hi rend="ital">to assume the appearance of</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">to feign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simulate</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n44347.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (in Cic. in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> perh. only with a <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec ut emat melius, nec ut vendat, quicquam simulabit aut dissimulabit vir bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">experiar, quid ames, quid simules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oportuit) non simulare mortem verbis, re ipsā spem vitae dare,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to pretend that she was dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium conjurationis vehementer simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionem ac deinde metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidentiam rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: pacem cum Scipione Sulla sive <cb n="SIMU" /> faciebat sive simulabat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibal aegrum simulabat,</quote> <trans><tr>pretended to be sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 429" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegravem aut delumbem sese simulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supervacaneos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulat se pro uxore Nini filium, pro femina puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum pol ego is essem vere, qui simulabar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non simulatur amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecto lumine somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:21:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad simulanda negotia altitudo ingenii incredibilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—Esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficto officio simulatāque sedulitate conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officio simulato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatā amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1,44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur simulata conscientia adeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex eo quaereretur, quid esset dolus malus? respondebat: cum esset aliud simulatum, aliud actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiā nihil fictum est, nihil simulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; so (with fictum) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with falsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with fucata (opp. vera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulato vecta juvenco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulatae ordine justo exsequiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 305</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44347.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia se simulant scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille se Tarentum proficisci cum simulasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi reverti se in suas sedes simulaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulat Jove natus abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 697</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 338 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. prol. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 68</bibl> sq. al.: <cit><quote lang="la">id mirari te simulato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 113</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 511, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulandum est, quaedam nos dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui per ambitionem probos sese simulavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adcurrit pedes ejus feta, praegravem, delumbem sese simulans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulans a Dareo se esse praemissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">schema, quo aliud simulatur dici quam dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44347.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi> (mostly Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi affuerim simulabo atque audita eloquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 1, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi militi animum adjeceris simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus, quasi et ipse conterritus, simulans cuncta pavore compleverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44347.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur simulat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in perpetuom ut dares, Verum ut simulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulandi gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:85" default="NO">6, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:299 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 299 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est, quod amplius simuletur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44347.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n44347.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Imitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit in terris vocum simulantior ales (psittaco),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44347.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmŭlans</orth>, <hi rend="ital">The Pretender</hi>, the title of a comedy of Afranius (v. the Fragm. Com. Rel. p. 172 sq. Rib.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:55:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 55, 118</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Advv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">feignedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretendedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparently</hi> (for the class. simulate): <cit><quote lang="la">simulanter revictā Charite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44347.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmŭlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">feignedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretendedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sincerely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ex animo id fit sive simulate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:67:168" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 67, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficte et simulate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: simulatius exit proditionis opus, Petr. poët. Fragm. 28, 4.</sense></entryFree>
simultas: <entryFree id="n44348" type="main" key="si^multas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmultas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n44348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> simultatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 60, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 66, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 12</bibl>; 28, 18, 12; 39, 5, 2; 39, 44, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 49, 2: simultatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 35, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 9, 2</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>simul; therefore, orig., a coming together, encounter of two persons or parties</etym>; hence, </sense><sense id="n44348.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hostile encounter</hi> of two persons or parties, <hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rivalry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jealousy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grudge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatred</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animosity</hi> (class.; syn.: aemulatio, odium, inimicitia; on account of the idea of reciprocity, most freq. in the <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n44348.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: hic id metuit, ne illam vendas ob simultatem suam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gero, II. A.: huic simultas cum Curione intercedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: cum quo si simultas tibi non fuisset, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 1</bibl>: sibi privatam simultatem cum Campanis nullam esse, publicas <cb n="SIN" /> inimicitias esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simultas cum familiā Barcinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se numquam cum sorore fuisse in simultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultate cum Fulviā socru exorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultatem deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; so (opp. gerere) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis simultatem indixerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc ad simultatem usque processit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nulla simultas Incidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter finitimos vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44348.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui simultates, quas mecum habebat, deposuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 35, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi (centuriones) de loco summis simultatibus contendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates partim obscuras partim apertas suscepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates graves excipere, deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates exercere ... alienarum simultatium cognitorem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates provocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultatibus alicujus dare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultates finire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:9" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 46, 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dirimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternas obliterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe simultates ira morata facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est simultatibus gravius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant inter Athenienses et Dorienses simultatium veteres offensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44348.4" n="II" level="1"> In Hyg., in gen., <hi rend="ital">a strife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contest</hi> for a prize (syn. certamen): <cit><quote lang="la">cum complures eam peterent in conjugium, simultatem constituit, se ei daturum, qui secum quadrigis certasset victorque exisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 84" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:185" default="NO">185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simultatem constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit> and 67.</sense></entryFree>
simulter: <entryFree id="n44349" type="main" key="si^multer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmulter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. similis <sense id="n44349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
simulus: <entryFree id="n44350" type="hapax" key="si_mu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n44350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dim. adj.</hi> [simus], <hi rend="ital">flat-nosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pug-nosed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44351" type="main" key="Si_mu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. simulus</etym>, <sense id="n44351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simus: <entryFree id="n44352" type="greek" key="si_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">simo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flat-nosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snub-nosed</hi> (cf. silus). </sense><sense id="n44352.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">avibus, serpentibus, piscibus, foramina tantum ad olfactus sine naribus, et hinc cognomina Simorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 59, § 158</bibl></cit>: pecus Nerei, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dolphins</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 335, 22</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 1 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rostrum delphini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer simā nare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44352.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sin: <entryFree id="n44353" type="main" key="si_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīn</orth>, <sense id="n44353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [apocop. from si-ne], an adversative conditional particle, <hi rend="ital">if however</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if on the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but if</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n44353.1" n="I" level="1"> With a preceding <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quando</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dum.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44353.2" n="A" level="2"> After <hi rend="ital">si.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44353.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si domi sum, foris est animus: sin foris sum, animus domi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: hunc mihi timorem eripe: si est verus, ne opprimar; <cit><quote lang="la">sin falsus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si optimates ... sin populus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos si boni oppresserunt ... sin audaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 37, 58: si nostri oblitus es ... sin aestivorum timor te debilitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui si improbasset ... sin' probasset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sine vi velint rapta tradere, redderent ... Sin aliter sient animati, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin aliter es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply sin aliter, with a verb understood,</quote> <trans><tr>but if not</tr>, <tr>in the contrary case</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:74 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 74 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin secus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator illum ... defendet, si poterit: sin minus poterit, negabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:29:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 29, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so simply sin minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44353.4" n="2" level="3"> In the epistolary style also, ellipt., sin (for sin aliter or sin minus): <cit><quote lang="la">si pares aeque inter se, quiescendum: sin, latius manabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, b, 2.—</sense><sense id="n44353.5" n="3" level="3"> Strengthened, </sense><sense id="n44353.6" n="(a)" level="5"> By <hi rend="ital">autem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si malus est ... sin autem frugi'st, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id si ita est, etc. ... sin autem illa veriora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 6</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:5:7 al" default="NO">31, 5, 7 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si sunt viri boni, me adjuvant ... sin autem minus idonei, me non laedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 34</bibl>; and in epistolary style, ellipti.: si vir esse volet, praeclara <foreign lang="greek">sunodi/a</foreign>: sin autem erimus nos, qui solemus <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 7, 2</bibl>.—So freq. in Vulg.: <cit><quote lang="la">si est tibi intellectus, responde proximo: sin autem, sit manus tua super os tutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 2, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44353.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Less freq. by <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>: si sit ovis matura<pb n="1706" /> <cb n="SINC" />  ... sin vero feta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44353.8" n="B" level="2"> After <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi molestum est, nomen dare vobis volo Comoediaï: sin odio est—dicam tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 51</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44353.9" n="C" level="2"> After <hi rend="ital">quando</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando abiit rete pessum, adducit lineam: sin jecit recte, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit> (Speng. si injecit).—* </sense><sense id="n44353.10" n="D" level="2"> After <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum illi agunt suam rem agunt, ceteri cleptae: sin vident quempiam se adservare, obludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44353.11" n="II" level="1"> Without a preceding <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>, etc. (where the foregoing particle is usu. clearly implied by the context). </sense><sense id="n44353.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ero servire servos postulat, etc. ... Sin dormitat, ita dormitet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 6</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Pae.</hi> Ne me attrecta. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Sin te amo? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum danda opera est, ne quā amicorum discidia fiant: sin tale aliquid evenerit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc nostri nulli fuerunt: sin quando exstiterint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orat ac postulat, rem publicam suscipiant. Sin timore defugiant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ut fiant, deos quaeso, ut vobis decet. Sin aliter animus voster est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44353.13" n="B" level="2"> In epistolary style, ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, ut constitui, adero: atque utinam tu quoque eodem die! Sin quid—multa enim—utique postridie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44353.14" n="C" level="2"> Strengthened, </sense><sense id="n44353.15" n="1" level="3"> By <hi rend="ital">autem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi puerorum amores saepe unā cum praetextā togā ponerentur: sin autem ad adulescentiam perduxissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n44353.16" n="2" level="3"> Rarely by <hi rend="ital">vero</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam saepe in parvā pecuniā cognoscuntur quam sint leves, quidam, etc., sin vero erunt aliqui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinapi: <entryFree id="n44354" type="greek" key="si^na_pi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnāpi</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnāpe</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnāpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 28</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 122; <case>acc.</case> sinapim, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 11, 2</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">si/napi</foreign>, <sense id="n44354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mustard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:236" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 22, 87, § 236</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> sinapis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 41, § 71</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> sinapi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinapismus: <entryFree id="n44355" type="greek" key="si^na_pismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnāpismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sinapismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mustard - plaster</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poultice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sinapism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:112" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinapizo: <entryFree id="n44356" type="greek" key="si^na_pi_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnāpīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sinapi/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n44356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to poultice with mustard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with a mustara-plaster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sincerasco: <entryFree id="n44357" type="main" key="since_rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērasco</orth>, <itype>rāvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n44357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sincerus], <hi rend="ital">to begin to clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow clear</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aer sinceravit, mundumque efficitur caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sincere: <entryFree id="n44358" type="main" key="since_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sincerus <sense id="n44358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
sinceritas: <entryFree id="n44359" type="main" key="since_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sincerus</etym>, <sense id="n44359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleanness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholeness</hi> (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n44359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pura (olei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma capitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia convertenda, quae sinceritatem habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44359.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec summum bonum habebit sinceritatem suam, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>moral purity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: ad perniciem solet agi sinceritas, <hi rend="ital">uprightness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honesty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">integrity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerity</hi> (with recte loqui), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 13, 3</bibl>; so (with probitas) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum (with veritas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44359.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sinceritas tua, a form of complimentary address to certain inferior dignitaries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinceriter: <entryFree id="n44360" type="main" key="since_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sincerus <sense id="n44360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
sincero: <entryFree id="n44361" type="main" key="since_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sincerus</etym>, <sense id="n44361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make clean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 361</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
sincerus: <entryFree id="n44362" type="main" key="since_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sin- = sim-, v. simplex; root in Sanscr. sama, whole, together; and root skir-, Sanscr. kir-, pour out</etym>, <sense id="n44362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not spoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninjured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">real</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincere</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense; cf.: simplex, verus, incorruptus). </sense><sense id="n44362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fucata et simulata a sinceris atque veris (internoscere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab omni incommodo, detrimento, molestiā sincerum integrumque conservare,</quote> <trans><tr>unharmed</tr>, <tr>unhurt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (with sine vulnere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porci sacres,</quote> <trans><tr>sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: cum jam me sinceriore corpusculo factum diceret (medicus), Gell. <cb n="SINE" /> 18, 10, 4: sincerum tergum ... corium sincerissimum, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (of weals), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:51 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 51 sq.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so, corium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <trans><tr>clean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex amphorā primum quod est sincerissimum effluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Amineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axungia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma (opp. sordium plena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propria et sincera et tantum sui similis gens,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:46" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 46</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: lux sincerior, App. de Mundo, p. 58, 29.—* </sense><sense id="n44362.2" n="b" level="4"> Sincerum, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sincerum sonĕre,</quote> <trans><tr>that it does not ring clearly</tr>, <tr>is not genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 873</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44362.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium semper fuit prudens sincerumque judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>sound</tr>, <tr>uncorrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat in ejus (Cottae) oratione nisi sincerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse videtur Homeri (versus) simplicior et sincerior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sincera gratia sermonis Attici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera et integra natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opiniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 94:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 94, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <trans><tr>pure</tr>, <tr>chaste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincerum equestre proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sincerum gaudium praebere,</quote> <trans><tr>not unmixed</tr>, <tr>not undisturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium sincerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>unblemished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides rerum gestarum pronunciator sincerus,</quote> <trans><tr>honest</tr>, <tr>candid</tr>, <tr>upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabii Annales, bonae atque sincerae vetustatis libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Claudius optimus et sincerissimus scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus atque sincerus Stoicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilia multa, nihil simplex, nihil sincerum,</quote> <trans><tr>natural</tr>, <tr>genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est jam sanctum neque sincerum in civitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid non sinceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44362.4" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">uprightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>: sincere dicere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' ego oculis utilitatem obtineo sincere, an parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincere et ex animo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:109:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 109, 4</bibl></cit>: pronunciare, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl>: agere, Attic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 55.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Volus. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Volus. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n44362.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 28, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sincinium: <entryFree id="n44363" type="main" key="sinci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sin- = sim- (cf. simplex) and cano</etym>, <sense id="n44363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the song of a single person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solo</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">monw|di/a</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sincipitamentum: <entryFree id="n44364" type="main" key="sinci^pi^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭpĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sinciput</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mikefa/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n44364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half - head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincipitamenta porcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit> Ritschl, Brix.</sense></entryFree>
sinciput: <entryFree id="n44365" type="main" key="sinci^put"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭput</orth>, <itype>pĭtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>semi - caput; cf.: sinciput <foreign lang="greek">h(mikefa/lion, h(mi/kranon, h(mike/falon</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</etym>. <sense id="n44365.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Half a head;</hi> of the smoked <hi rend="ital">cheek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jowl</hi> of a hog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl> (Ritschl, sincipitamenta); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44365.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44365.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The brain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi Sanum est, adulescens, sinciput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44365.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The head</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabile sinciput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 419</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sindenses: <entryFree id="n44366" type="main" key="Sindenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sinda</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*sinda</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a town of Pisidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cibyra and the river Caularis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
